member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.CssTextFormatting
member.summary: CssTextFormatting provides methods to format text selections or text blocks using CSS inline styles.
member.remarks:
This class should never called directly from user code. It is necessary to use the property to request a singleton instance of the class to access the various properties and methods. This assures that all requests are assigned to the current document only.
For dealing with an instance of the class it is recommended to use the interface as type.
This class was introduced with Netrix 2 in Spring 2011 release to avoid conflicts with the classic formatting behavior, as exposed by the class.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlTextFormatting.GetBlockFormats
member.summary: Gets the block format command strings from MSHTML.
member.remarks: The block format command parameters depend on the MSHTML version and language. For example: The english version accepts "Header1" whereas the german version needs "Überschrift1", in MSHTML 6.0. It is strongly recommended to gather the block formats before sending any block formatting command to the editor component.
member.returns: Array of format command strings

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlTextFormatting.GetFormatString(GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormat)
member.summary: Translate the language dependent block formatting commands into the internal used enumaration

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlTextFormatting.ClearSelection
member.summary: Removes the selection the user has made.
member.remarks: This method does not delete the content currently selected.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlTextFormatting.RemoveParagraphFormat

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlTextFormatting.GetBoldInfo
member.summary: Gets the current state of the bold command (enabled and/or checked).
member.remarks: The state depends on the current caret position and may vary if the caret moves. It refers to the allowed commands and does not check if issuing the command make sense. Therefore setting bold inside a tag that is already bold, doesn't make any sense. But it will result in valid HTML and therefore issuing the command wil allowed. It is up the host application to build a more clever user interface by checking the parent/child hierachies.
member.returns: Returns a value of type HtmlCommandInfo.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlTextFormatting.GetHtmlFormat

member.remarks: The block format can be "Header 1", "Unordered List", etc. and the method returns it in the internal enum format to stay language independent. HtmlFormat
member.returns: HtmlFormat enumeration

member.remarks: RTL is used for languages primarily running from right to left, like arabic, whereas LTR is used for western languages.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlTextFormatting.FontName
member.summary: Gets and sets the font name of the current text.
member.remarks:
Any call to the set path will remove empty attributes, if the current element is a font element and the attribute is empty. If no more attributes left the font tag is removed.
The intention if this property is NOT to change the font face of any font attribute which is valid in the parent hierarchy. This means, that only an active selection with one or more characters will encapsulated with the font tag. To get the current element just use HtmlEditor.GetCurrentElement or get the current element form HtmlElementChanged event. If the current element is the font element the property face can be used to set or retrieve the current font face value.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlTextFormatting.FontSize
member.summary: Gets and sets the font size of the current text.
member.remarks:
Any call to the set path will remove empty attributes, if the current element is a font element and the attribute is empty. If no more attributes left the font tag is removed.
The intention if this property is NOT to change the font size of any font attribute which is valid in the parent hierarchy. This means, that only an active selection with one or more characters will encapsulated with the font tag. To get the current element just use HtmlEditor.GetCurrentElement or get the current element form HtmlElementChanged event. If the current element is the font element the property size can be used to set or retrieve the current font size value.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlTextFormatting.ForeColor
member.summary: The foreground color of the current text.
member.remarks:
Any call to the set path will remove empty attributes, if the current element is a font element and the attribute is empty. If no more attributes left the font tag is removed.
The intention if this property is NOT to change the color of any font attribute which is valid in the parent hierarchy. This means, that only an active selection with one or more characters will encapsulated with the font tag. To get the current element just use HtmlEditor.GetCurrentElement or get the current element form HtmlElementChanged event. If the current element is the font element the property color can be used to set or retrieve the current color value.
BackColor

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlTextFormatting.BackColor
member.summary: Sets the background of the current text selection to the given color.
member.remarks:
This property cannot be applied if no text is selected. Any call to the set path will remove empty attributes, if the current element is a font element and the attribute is empty. If no more attributes left the font tag is removed.
The intention if this property is NOT to change the font face of any font attribute which is valid in the parent hierarchy. This means, that only an active selection with one or more characters will encapsulated with the font tag. To get the current element just use HtmlEditor.GetCurrentElement or get the current element form HtmlElementChanged event. If the current element is the font element the style attribute background-color can be used.
For an example see ForeColor property.
ForeColor

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Html5.AsideElement
member.summary: This class represents the <aside> element.
member.remarks:
The tag specifies some content aside from the content it is placed in. The aside content should be related to the surrounding content.
Classes directly or indirectly inherited from are not intended to be instantiated directly by the host application. Use the various insertion or creation methods in the base classes instead. The return values are of type and can be casted into the element just created.
Examples of how to create and modify elements with the native element classes can be found in the description of other element classes.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element
member.summary: The base class for all elements.
member.remarks: This class defines the basic propertygrid behavior and all helper methods to deal with attributes. This class is not intended to be used directly from users code. This class implements IElement and ICloneable. The latter is used to built shallow copy clones of elements.

member.summary: The child of the element or null if it does not have children.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.GetChildren
member.summary: Returns the collection of children of the element.
member.remarks: The returned collection will always beeing created, but it could be empty if there are no children. The collection will contain all children elements that follow the current element, even their children. To get only the direct descendants use ElementDom.GetChildNodes instead.
member.returns: Collection of elements of type IElement.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.GetParent
member.summary: The parent of the current element or null if no parent.
member.remarks: Instead of the access in this property returns the object as base class type , and therefore accepts types defined in plug-ins, too. is a specialized DOM access method implemented especially for derived types. Plug-ins may implement there own version or allow access to the private element DOM elsewhere.
member.returns: Returns the base class of child element or null, if there was no parent element.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.GetRelativeUrl(System.String)
member.summary: This method takes a full (absolute) URL and returns it as relative URL.
member.remarks:
This method is internally used to deal with relative paths even if the control need absolute paths for images and other sources. The base URL which is used to recognize the relative path is found in the property.
If that path set to c:\inetpub\wwwroot\path\ and the absolute path of an image is c:\inetpub\wwwroot\path\image\xxx.jpg the method will return "image\xxx.jpg". The PropertyGrid uses this to display only relative parts.
Additionally a possibly attached file:// moniker will be removed. Hashmarks (#) at the end of the string will not harm the resolvation. The method removes them before resolvation and add them at the end.
member.param: The absolute URL of a source.
member.returns: The relative part accordingly to the base URL.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.GetDocumentStyleSelectors(GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Styles.StyleType)
member.summary: This method return all style selectors linkes with the current document this element is in.
member.remarks: The type will by recognized by the sign typically used for selectors, like ".class", "#id", and "@rule".
member.param: String with the type
member.returns: Array of objects

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.GetStyle
member.summary: This method return the complete CSS inline definition, which the style attribute contains.
member.remarks: For easy access to specific styles it is recommended to use the GetStyleAttribute and SetStyleAttribute methods. This and both alternative methods will check the content and cannot assign values not processed by the Internet Explorer Engine. The final behavior may vary depending on the currently installed IE engine.

member.summary: Sets or removes an event handler function that fires when the user moves the mouse pointer into the object.
member.remarks: Unlike the OnMouseOver event, the MouseEnter event does not bubble. In other words, the MouseEnter event does not fire when the user moves the mouse pointer over elements contained by the object, whereas MouseOver does fire.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.ContentEditable
member.summary: Gets or sets explicitly the design mode for this element.
member.value: Setting to true will set the attribute "contentEditable", which is visible in the documents DOM. Returning the value false means that the mode is not explicitly set but may be inherited. Setting a parent to ContentEditable will not change the value for the children, but in fact, they are now editable.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.AtomicSelection
member.summary: The element with this property set to TRUE will be selectable only as a unit.
member.remarks: This property is only available

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.Unselectable
member.summary: Makes the element unselectable, so the user cannot activate it for resizing or moving.
member.remarks: The property is ignored if the element is already an unselectable element. Only block elements like DIV, TABLE, and IMG can be selectable.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.InnerHtml
member.summary: Gets or sets inner html of the element.
member.remarks: The inner html is the complete content between the opening and the closing tag. If the element is not a container element the property will return String.Empty. Any HTML is returned "as is", with the braces and tag names.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.InnerText
member.summary: Gets or sets the inner text of the element.
member.remarks: The inner text is the complete content between the opening and the closing tag, with any HTML tags stripped out. If the element is not a container element the property will return String.Empty. Any HTML is returned "as is", with the braces and tag names.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.OuterHtml
member.summary: Gets or sets outer html of the element.
member.remarks: The outer html is the complete content between the opening and the closing tag and it includes the tags themselfes. If the element is not a container element the property will return String.Empty. Any HTML is returned "as is", with the braces and tag names.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.TagElement
member.summary: Gives direct access to the element object from datasource or collection based lists.
member.remarks: Used for lists which needs a property to access collection members for displaying purposes. To prevent such lists from deleting the object we send only a shallow copy clone. This allows the caller to change all properties but deleting does not modify the DOM.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.TagName
member.summary: The name of the element.
member.remarks: If the loaded document supports XML and does contain namespaces, the property does not return the assigned alias. See and instead.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.Alias
member.summary: Returns the alias of the element's namespace.
member.remarks: HTML elements does have the legacy alias HTML, which is never ever required to be written in documents explicitly. This feature does not require XML plugins for proper support.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.ElementName
member.summary: Complete name of element including the alias.
member.remarks: If the loaded document supports XML and does contain namespaces, the property does return the assigned alias and name in usual form "alias:name". See also and for other naming information properties.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.EffectiveStyle
member.summary: Gets the current STYLE definition.
member.remarks:
This property shows the effective style if this element as a cascade of the global and inline styles defined elsewhere. Readonly.
The property returns null (Nothing in VB.NET) if the effective style can not be retrieved.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element.RuntimeStyle
member.summary: The runtime style provide access to additonal appearance information at runtime. Does not persist.
member.remarks: This property allows access to styles not being persistent within the document. They affect only at runtime and can change the current appearance of an object. One can use this to add specific effects during user operation of to customize elements in particular situations.

member.summary: The ID attribute.
member.remarks: This attribute defines an unique ID to the element. It can be used to assign styles from a style sheet (CSS) or to access the element using Scripting.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.SimpleInlineElement.style
member.summary: Defines the STYLE attribute.
member.remarks: The STYLE attribute can contain inline style definitions. If the NetRix UI is used (not supported by Light Version) the integrated style editor of the UI assembly can be used to create the styles.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.StyledElement.ScriptOnClick
member.summary: onClick sets a script to run when the user clicks on the link.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.StyledElement.ScriptOnMouseOver
member.summary: onMouseOver is an event handlers that is triggered when the mouse moves over the link.
member.remarks: The most common use for these event handler are rollover images, but you put any kind of program in them you want.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.StyledElement.ScriptOnMouseOut
member.summary: onMouseOut is an event handler that is triggered when the mouse moves out from the element again.
member.remarks: The most common use for these event handler are rollover images, but you put any kind of program in them you want.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.StyledElement.title
member.summary: W3C says that TITLE is "an advisory title for the linked resource".
member.remarks:
The idea is that TITLE gives a description of the linked resource that is more informative than the URL.
Most browsers have ignored this useful attribute. One that doesn't ignore it is Opera. Opera displays the value of TITLE in a small box when the pointer is over a link. The latest version of MSIE also shows a little box over the link, but otherwise ignores TITLE.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Html5.Html5Base.spellcheck
member.summary: Specifies if the element must have its spelling and grammar checked
member.remarks: This attribute does not has any internal meaning. It's just to support the creation of valid HTML 5 content.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Html5.Html5Base.hidden
member.summary: Specifies that the element is not relevant.
member.remarks: Hidden elements are not displayed.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Html5.AsideElement.#ctor(GuruComponents.Netrix.IHtmlEditor)
member.summary: Creates the specified element.
member.remarks:
The element is being created and attached to the current document, but nevertheless not visible, until it's being placed anywhere within the DOM. To attach an element it's possible to either use the property of any other already placed element and refer to this DOM or use the body element () and add the element there. Also, in case of user interactive solutions, it's possible to add an element near the current caret position, using method.
Note: Invisible elements do neither appear in the DOM nor do they get saved.
member.param: The editor this element belongs to.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Html5.AsideElement.title
member.summary: In some browsers the title attribute can be used to show the full version of the expression when you are holding the mouse over the abbreviation.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Html5.ArticleElement
member.summary: This class represents the <article> element.
member.remarks:
This element indicates an article. The tag specifies independent, self-contained content. An article should make sense on its own and it should be possible to distribute it independently from the rest of the site.
Examples of possible articles:
forum post newspaper article blog entry user comment
Classes directly or indirectly inherited from are not intended to be instantiated directly by the host application. Use the various insertion or creation methods in the base classes instead. The return values are of type and can be casted into the element just created.
Examples of how to create and modify elements with the native element classes can be found in the description of other element classes.

member.name: T:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor
member.summary: This is the editor control with the basic functionality.

remarks.para: The main assembly has a satellite contract attribute to unlink the version relation between the main and the satellite assemblies. You should set all new satellites always to "1.0.0.0" to make the resource manager operate properly, even if the version of the main assembly is much higher.

A basic application must only assure that any commands are issued after receiving of event. When the control loads a document, it starts an synchronous parse procedure internally. This might take some time, even if the parser is really fast and common document parse and appear within microseconds, it takes a while and it's not recommended to assume in code that this procedure is always fast enough. Therefore, the event is the only guarantee that the content is ready and all commands can be issued safely.

The editor has an integrated UI, that is, a toolstrip container with several toolstrips, a menustrip, and two rulers. Each part can be switched on and off using the Visual Studio.NET designer within the smart tag dialog. Several tools are processed internally, but some are not. In any case the event is being fired and this event is cancallable. That means, the host application can cancel the internal processing in case the click is handled elsewhere. In fact , for some tools the host application must handle the click.

Plug-Ins can extend the control, if they implement the interface and being implemented as ExtenderProvider. This means, they appear on the component tray and extend the base control implicitly. Additional properties appear within the PropertyGrid.

member.example:
To instantiate the control just call the constructor:
using GuruComponents.Netrix;
HtmlEditor htmlEditor1 = new HtmlEditor(); // do some stuff with the editor here A basic application to implement a HTML editor solution must provide these functions:
An instance of the component.
The ReadyStateComplete event attached to a handler.
A handler which sets the control into design mode on request.
After having this the user can put the control into design mode and the application can look for the ready state complete event. It is important that no function is called before this event was fired.
Take a look at the various methods and properties to see more examples of how to use it.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.HideCaret
member.summary: The HideCaret function removes the caret from the screen.
member.remarks: Hiding a caret does not destroy its current shape or invalidate the insertion point.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.ShowCaret
member.summary: The ShowCaret function makes the caret visible on the screen at the caret's current position.
member.remarks:
When the caret becomes visible, it begins flashing automatically. ShowCaret shows the caret only if the specified window owns the caret, the caret has a shape, and the caret has not been hidden two or more times in a row. If one or more of these conditions is not met, ShowCaret does nothing and returns false.
Hiding is cumulative. If your application calls HideCaret five times in a row, it must also call ShowCaret five times before the caret reappears.
The system provides one caret per queue. A window should create a caret only when it has the keyboard focus or is active. The window should destroy the caret before losing the keyboard focus or becoming inactive. In NetRix this is the default behavior and there is no need to manipulate the caret directly but a different behavior is required.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.ReflectInnerType(System.String)

member.remarks: This method is used by plug-ins to get access to internal types. The method works lazy and returns null (Nothing in VB) in case of error.
member.param: The full qualified name.
member.returns: The Type, if the name was found and is declared in 'Guru.Netrix.Professional.Editor.v4.dll'.

member.param: Value for zoom, 1 equals 100%. Set 0.5 for 50% or 2.0 for 200%.

member.remarks: Search stops and fails if body is reached ==> element is not in document tree. Search returns the first occurence of element, therefore the innermost element of a nested structure is recognized.

member.summary: Searches the element tree upwards to detect the next element the current element is in.
member.remarks: Search stops and fails if body is reached ==> element is not in document tree. Search returns the first occurence of element, therefore the innermost element of a nested structure is recognized.
member.param: IElement element or null if not found.
The tag name which the methods searches for.
member.returns: Returns the element, if found.

member.summary: Insert Text at Caret position.

member.param: Text that has to be inserted.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.CreateElementAtCaret(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts a generic created element at the current caret position.
member.remarks: This method internally calls to add the element to the documents DOM. After that, the element is inserted. The method may fail if the element cannot be inserted at caret position. The control will not accept invalid HTML. In case of error an internal exception is thrown and catched. The method will return null (Nothing in VB.NET) if no success.
member.param: The name of tag to be inserted. Use "span" to insert <span>, for instance.
member.returns: Returns True on success, False otherwise.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.InsertElementAtCaret(GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.IElement)
member.summary: Insert the element at the current caret position.
member.remarks: This method inserts an element based on a "template" element. It returns the real element instead.
member.param: The element which has to be inserted, will be replaced by a clone of the element which points to the inserted one.
member.returns: Returns True on success or False if the insertion fails.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.CreateElement(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the element for the specified tag.
member.remarks:
This method does not add the element to the DOM, it makes it available for adding later.
You can create all elements programmatically, except for <frame> and <iframe>. In addition, the properties of these created elements are read/write and can be accessed programmatically. Before you use new objects, you must explicitly add them to their respective collections or to the document's DOM. To insert new elements into the current document, use the InsertBefore or AppendChild methods.
You must perform a second step when using CreateElement to create the <input> element. The method generates an InputTextElement, because that is the default input type property. To insert any other kind of input element, first invoke CreateElement for input, then set the type property to the appropriate value in the next line of code.
inputElement.SetAttribute("type", "radio");
Attributes can be included with the tagName parameter as long as the entire string is valid HTML. You should do this if you wish to include the NAME attribute at run time on objects created with the createElement method. Attributes should be included with the sTag when form elements are created that are to be reset using the reset method or a BUTTON with a TYPE attribute value of reset.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.OnElementCreated(System.Web.UI.Control)
member.summary: Called when a new element has been created successfully.
member.param: The element which has been created.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.GetCurrentScopeElement
member.summary: Get the current element which is in the scope for next editing operation.
member.remarks:
Caller can cast the object to the right IElement derived type.
If it's more important to get the current element, which has fired the last event or is set by event, it's better to use the method. Under normal circumstances both method return the same element, but during key or mouse operations in nested element hierarchies there might be a difference between currency and scope.
member.returns: The element object

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.GetCurrentElement
member.summary: Gets the current element.
member.remarks: This method returns the current element, as it is set by event. If the element wasn't recognized for some reason the method returns the Body Element
member.returns: The current element object.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.PrintPageSetup
member.summary: Shows the internal Page Setup Dialog.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.PrintWithPreview
member.summary: Shows the print preview and let the user optionally print.
member.remarks: To use the print feature the control must be able to reload the current content internally. Therefore the host application must provide a path or URL to the LoadXXX methods before a printing process can start. Without a valid path the print command is ignored and the preview will display a blank page.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.PrintWithPreview(System.String)
member.summary: Prints a document using a customized preview from the given print template.
member.remarks: To use the print feature the control must be able to reload the current content internally. Therefore the host application must provide a path or URL to the LoadXXX methods before a printing process can start. Without a valid path the print command is ignored and the preview will display a blank page.
member.param: The path to the HTML code creating the print template.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.PrintImmediately
member.summary: Print the current document to the current printer without any user interaction.
member.remarks: To use the print feature the control must be able to reload the current content internally. Therefore the host application must provide a path or URL to the LoadXXX methods before a printing process can start. Without a valid path the print command is ignored and the method will print a blank page.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SendIDMCommand(System.Int32,System.Object)
member.summary: This method sends an IDM command directly to MSHTML.
member.remarks:
The call is protected by a try/catch block. The method does not throw an exception on error and does always return nothing. This method is just for experimental environments and should not used in production environments.
This is method is subject to be changed or removed in later versions without further notice.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.OnContentChanged
member.summary: Fires the event.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.GetFullPathUrl
member.summary: Gets the full decoded path to the file this document is load locally from.
member.remarks: This can be an URL, but under most circumstances this may be a Path. Any monikers of type "file://" are removed.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches and replaces a string.
member.param: String to search for
String to replace with
true if case sensitive
true if only whole words (search string matches word boundaries) found
true if search upwards, false otherwise
member.returns: Number of replaces

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.Replace(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches and replaces a string.
member.remarks:
The method uses the callback to event to inform the host application about thew next replacement. If no handler present, the method will continuously replace all occurences of the string. The event handler can set a property of type DialogResult to control the behavior of the Replace method. The various field of the DialogResult enumeration have the following meaning:
YesReplace
OKReplace
NoneEnd method and stop all replacements (e.g. Cancel)
CancelEnd method and stop all replacements (e.g. Cancel)
AbortEnd method and stop all replacements (e.g. Cancel)
NoSkip this (current) replacement, but continue.
IgnoreSkip this (current) replacement, but continue.
RetryStart replacement at the beginning. (Helpful after some words were skipped)
Version 1.6.2008 (Aug 2008): Added support for spell checking within TextArea Elements.
member.param: String to search for
String to replace with
True if case sensitive
True if only whole words (search string matches word boundaries) found
True if search upwards, false otherwise
Limits the number of replacements.
member.returns: Number of replaces

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.Find(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches for a text string in the whole document.
member.remarks:
Searches document for a given string and, if the string was found, returns true. The search stops at the first hit and starts from the last stop. Subsequent calls jump from hit to hit. The document will automatically scroll to the marked position.
The method does not stop at end. After the end of document has been reached the method returns to the document start. See other overloads for information about the StopAtEnd parameter.
The method uses the whole document as search range. To move the range a specific number of characters see other overloads.
member.param: A string to search for.
Must be set to true if match case is required.
Must set to true if only whole words should be found.
Must set to true to search backwards.
member.returns: Returns true if something was found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.Find(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches for a text string in the whole document.
member.remarks: Searches document for a given string and, if the string was found, returns true. The search stops at the first hit and starts from the last stop. Subsequent calls jump from hit to hit. The document will automatically scroll to the marked position.
member.param: A string to search for.
Must be set to true if match case is required.
Must set to true if only whole words should be found.
Must set to true to search backwards.
By default the Find method "loops", e.g. it doesn't stop after reaching the end of document. If set to true the method stops at end.
member.returns: Returns true if something was found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.Find(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches for a text string in the whole document.
member.remarks: Searches document for a given string and, if the string was found, returns true. The search stops at the first hit and starts from the last stop. Subsequent calls jump from hit to hit. The document will automatically scroll to the marked position.
member.param: A string to search for.
Must be set to true if match case is required.
Must set to true if only whole words should be found.
Must set to true to search backwards.
If set to true the process stops if the end of document is reached.
Number of characters the search range is supposed to move before Find starts. Default is 0 (no move).
member.returns: Returns true if something was found, false otherwise.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.FindCheckEndPoint(GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.IHTMLTxtRange,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks for reaching the document end compared with the current find range.
member.param: Current Range
Hint that the string was found.
member.returns: Returns true when the end point was reached.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.ClearDirtyState
member.summary: Reset the dirty state flag to inform the control that the current state is used as unchanged state.
member.remarks: This may result in removing the Undo history under some circumstances.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SetAuthentication(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets username and password for silent authentication on protected sites.
member.remarks: If these parameters are set the control tries to authenticate using these values if a site requests authentication. This in fact suppresses the typical authentication dialog. After changing the values it is necessary to call LoadHtml or LoadUrl again.
member.param: The username the control should send on request.
The password the control should send on request.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.OnWebException(System.Net.WebException,System.String@)
member.summary: Called if an exception occured during loading resources from web.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.ClearAuthenticationCache
member.overloads: There are two overloads of this method.
member.summary: This method resets the current credentials applied to the control.
member.remarks: After successfull authentication to a secure site the control will reuse the credentials on any further access. To avoid this and to re-force the authentication, a call to this method is applicable. Calling this method will not reset the username and password set with SetAuthentication.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.ClearAuthenticationCache(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method resets the current credentials applied to the control and remove the username and password.
member.remarks: After successfull authentication to a secure site the control will reuse the credentials on any further access. To avoid this and to re-force the authentication, a call to this method is applicable. Calling this method will clear the username and password set with SetAuthentication. Further calls to a protected site will always fail if no new username and password beeing set before.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SavePartialHtml(GuruComponents.Netrix.WebEditing.Elements.Element)
member.summary: A helper method used to save uncomplete documents. If the host application needs the body content it is recommended to grab for the Body element and retrieve the InnerText or InnerHtml property.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.GetRawHtml
member.summary: Retrieves the HTML contained in control to a string and return it.
member.remarks:
The content is unchanged "as is" the MSHTML control provides it.
This method returns always the content of the base document. In case of a framed document this is the document containing the frameset definitions. The host application must use the HtmlFrameSet and related objects to call the save methods there to save the content of each frame document separatly.
member.returns: The HTML in the control

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.GetRawHtml(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the HTML contained in control to a string and return it.
member.remarks:
The content is unchanged "as is" the MSHTML control provides it.
This method returns always the content of the base document. In case of a framed document this is the document containing the frameset definitions. The host application must use the HtmlFrameSet and related objects to call the save methods there to save the content of each frame document separatly.
member.param: If set to true the call of this method will reset the IsDirty flag.
member.returns: The HTML in the control

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.GetRawHtml(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the HTML contained in control to a string and return it.
member.remarks:
The content is unchanged "as is" the MSHTML control provides it.
This method returns always the content of the base document. In case of a framed document this is the document containing the frameset definitions. The host application must use the HtmlFrameSet and related objects to call the save methods there to save the content of each frame document separatly.
member.param: If set to true the call of this method will reset the IsDirty flag.
If set to true, the currently active frame is the source, otherwise the frame definition document. This parameter is ignored, if the document has no frames.
member.returns: The HTML in the control

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.GetFormattedHtml
member.summary: Returns a well formatted representation of the current document.
member.remarks: Uses the default formatter, see . This formatter is set to single space as indent char, 4 spaces indent size, 128 characters line length, and produces XHTML compliant code. Once the property is set for the very first time the defaults are no longer valid and any further call will use the custom settings.
member.exception: Thrown if either the indent size or max line length is less than 0.
member.returns: Returns the formatted string.

member.param: for formatting this streams content.

member.returns: Returns the formatted string.

For framed documents loaded at once, this parameter can be used to get the content of the current (active) frame instead the base document.
member.exception: Thrown if either the indent size or max line length is less than 0.
member.returns: Returns the formatted string.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SaveHtml(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the HTML contained in the control to a stream.
member.remarks: Throws an if the parameter is null. Uses the global Encoding property for document encoding.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SaveFormattedHtml(System.IO.Stream,GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.IHtmlFormatterOptions)
member.summary: Saves the HTML contained in the control to a stream.
member.remarks:
Throws an if the parameter is null. Uses the global Encoding property for document encoding. Another method uses the GetRawHtml or GetFormattedHtml methods, which return content of the editor as string. It is up to the host application to use the common .NET file classes to save the content. The class HtmlFormatterOptions provides a way to control the beautifier and formatter. The various properties are:
IndentChar
IndentSize
MaxLineLength
AsXhtml
ElementCasing
AttributeCasing
Note: Both save methods throw an ArgumentNullException if the stream parameter is null. If it is possible that the stream is null under some circumstances, we should put a try/catch block around the call.
HtmlFormatterOptions
member.exception: Fired if stream parameter is null.
member.param: for formatting this streams content.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SaveMht(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the previously loaded content as MHTML stream.
member.remarks:
If the file does not exist the method will create it. If the file exists the method will overwrite it.
The main idea of the MHTML standard is that you send a HTML document, together with in-line graphics, applets, etc., and also other linked documents if you so wish, in a MIME multipart/related body part. The content of the HTML part is coded in quoted printable format. The images and binary objects are coded in Base64, always chunked in segments to 76 characters per line.
The IE can save and view MHTML. The preferred extension is MHT. NetRix works similiar to the basic MHTML save routine, but does not use the internal interfaces.
Attention: The method returns the content as it if was loaded the first time. ANY CHANGE DURING DESIGNTIME IS NOT RECOGNIZED. To save the current content the host application MUST save and reload the content AND wait for the next ReadyStateComplete event before this method can work properly.
Know Issues: This method is EXPERIMENTAL. It does not save frames properly and it does not handle local absolute paths correctly.
member.param: The full path the content is saved into.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SaveMht(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the previously loaded content as MHTML stream.
member.remarks:
If the file does not exist the method will create it. If the file exists the method will overwrite it.
The main idea of the MHTML standard is that you send a HTML document, together with in-line graphics, applets, etc., and also other linked documents if you so wish, in a MIME multipart/related body part. The content of the HTML part is coded in quoted printable format. The images and binary objects are coded in Base64, always chunked in segments to 76 characters per line.
The IE can save and view MHTML. The preferred extension is MHT. NetRix works similiar to the basic MHTML save routine, but does not use the internal interfaces.
The method fails if the document is not ready yet.
Attention: The method returns the content as it if was loaded the first time. ANY CHANGE DURING DESIGNTIME IS NOT RECOGNIZED. To save the current content the host application MUST save and reload the content AND wait for the next ReadyStateComplete event before this method can work properly.
Know Issues: This method is EXPERIMENTAL. It does not save frames properly and it does not handle local absolute paths correctly.
member.param: A stream (primarily a FileStream) to which the content is saved.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SaveMht
member.summary: Saves the previously loaded content as MHTML string.
member.remarks:
Be aware that the string contains the page and all embedded resources as one block of coded data. This is approximatly 33% more than the sum of all file sizes (due to the Base64 coding). A normal page can produce a huge string and the processing may take a while.
The main idea of the MHTML standard is that you send a HTML document, together with in-line graphics, applets, etc., and also other linked documents if you so wish, in a MIME multipart/related body part. The content of the HTML part is coded in quoted printable format. The images and binary objects are coded in Base64, always chunked in segments to 76 characters per line.
The IE can save and view MHTML. The preferred extension is MHT. NetRix works similiar to the basic MHTML save routine, but does not use the internal interfaces.
Attention: The method returns the content as it if was loaded the first time. ANY CHANGE DURING DESIGNTIME IS NOT RECOGNIZED. To save the current content the host application MUST save and reload the content AND wait for the next ReadyStateComplete event before this method can work properly.
member.returns: The string to which the content was written or null, if there is no content or the document is not ready.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.ReLoadHtml(System.String)
member.summary: This method replaces the content of the whole designer.
member.remarks: The relation to the previously loaded URL or filename is left untouched. The content is also beeing rewritten to the file and reloaded from that location. This assures that the paths to relative embedded objects are still valid. ReLoadHtml
member.param: Content which replaces the current content

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.ReLoadUrl(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method replaces the content of the whole designer.
member.remarks:
This is the preferred methos to refresh the content. If the content was externally changed, it is necessary to save the content before the reload takes place. If saving is not done, the old content will replace all changes.
It is up to the host application to decide where to save the content. If the parameter saveContent is set to true, the component will save the content internally and overwrite the original file without further questions.
member.exception: Thrown if the path is not valid or not a file.
member.param: Content which replaces the current content

If true, the component will save the the current content to file and reload from file then. If false the component will load the last not saved content from the related URL. This means, that any unsaved content will be lost. There is no UNDO on this action available.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.ReLoadUrl(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method simply refreshes the content to rebuild all relations, like linked stylesheets.
member.remarks: A call to this method can force the save operation on request.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SaveFile
member.summary: Saves the content as a file to the location the content was previously loaded from.
member.remarks: The method checks whether the file already exists and tries to create the file if it does not exist. The name of the method is used as a file name. If the path does not point to a filesystem with write permissions an exception occurs.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SaveFile(System.String)
member.summary: Save the current content into a file.
member.remarks:
This method saves the "raw" content which consists of unformatted HTML. This method requires Write access to the file. The file will be created if it doesn't exists.
The method checks whether the file already exists and tries to create the file if it does not exist. The name of the method is used as a file name. If the path does not point to a filesystem with write permissions an exception occurs.
member.param: The filename optionally including the full path.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.SaveFile(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the current "raw" content into a stream. The stream is not closed and remains open.
member.param: The stream the content is written into.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.LoadUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Loads HTML content from a URL or local path.
member.remarks:
This is the preferred load method. It can take HTML content from the following sources:
A locally stored file
An URL, with the leading "http://" (required)
The method will fire the Loading before the load process starts, but not when the URL or filename was not accepted. This can be used to check the processing, e.g. if the event does not fire the URL is wrong or the filename was not found. If the processing is done the Loaded event will fired. Remember that the next editing command MUST wait until the ReadyStateComplete was fired, which takes a bit more time used by the control to render and display of the content.
Use LoadHtml to load memory based strings only.
If MSHTML has not yet been created, the loading is postponed until MSHTML has been created. The method uses internally IMoniker to set the current base path to resolve relative paths in src and href attributes without changing the parameters.
member.param: URL (http://any.domain.com/file.html) or file (C:\whatever\path\file.html) to load from.

member.summary: Delete temporarily used file. Called on each LoadHtml and finally with Dispose().

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.LoadDocx(System.String)
member.summary: Load a docx document from given full path.

remarks.para: Docx is being converted into HTML and loaded after transformation. The control does not write the document back as Docx. Instead, the converted and loaded HTML is being written back.

member.exception: Thrown if filePath is null or empty.
Thrown if folder does not exists.
Thrown if file does not exists.
Cannot transform DOCX into HTML for some reason. See inner exception.
member.param: The path and filename the file is loaded from.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.LoadHtml(System.IO.FileStream)
member.summary: Loads HTML content from a stream into this control.
member.remarks:
It is recommended to use a FileStream for that procedure, because internally the name is extracted from the file name of the underlying stream. Otherwise any stream is possible which can be used with the StreamReader class. The method will fire the Loading before the load process starts, but not when the URL or filename was not accepted. This can be used to check the processing, e.g. if the event does not fire the URL is wrong or the filename was not found. If the processing is done the Loaded event will fired. Remember that the next editing command MUST wait until the ReadyStateComplete was fired, which takes a bit more time used by the control to render and display of the content.
If MSHTML has not yet been created, the loading is postponed until MSHTML has been created. The method uses internally IMoniker to set the current base path to resolve relative paths in src and href attributes without changing the parameters.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.LoadHtml(System.String)
member.summary: Loads HTML content from a string into this control.
member.remarks:
If previously used stream or file load process was used the existing URL (e.g. the filename) remains. If in a previous operation was no name set the default name "localhost" was set. The method will fire the Loading before the load process starts, but not when the URL or filename was not accepted. This can be used to check the processing, e.g. if the event does not fire the URL is wrong or the filename was not found. If the processing is done the Loaded event will fired. Remember that the next editing command MUST wait until the ReadyStateComplete was fired, which takes a bit more time used by the control to render and display of the content.
If MSHTML has not yet been created, the loading is postponed until MSHTML has been created. The method uses internally IMoniker to set the current base path to resolve relative paths in src and href attributes without changing the parameters.
If content is empty or null, the procedure is passed but does nothing but firing the load events. In that case old content might stay not be removed. Call instead.
This method will set the control into non file based mode, as there is no filename provided.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.RegisterElement(GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlFormatting.Elements.ITagInfo,System.Type)
member.summary: Registers an element for internal processing.
member.remarks:
The type class must have a public constructor which must accept exact one parameter of type IHTMLElement. Once the element is registered, the control tries to get the constructor, instantiate an object and return the object to the caller. Some of the events the control fires use these generic object creation to expose native element objects to the host application.
To obtain the ITagInfo object instantiate it using the TagInfo class or any class which implements ITagInfo. When creating an ITagInfo object for elements which resides in a specific namespace, one must include the namespace alias which registered whithin the control. The namespace must have been registered before the first element is added.
The type the element object is created from must implement IElement.
RegisterNamespace
member.param: The formatting information.
The type of element.

member.name: M:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.GetRegisteredNamespaceParent(GuruComponents.Netrix.ComInterop.Interop.IHTMLElement)
member.summary: Try to find the next parent element in the hierarchy which belongs to one of the registered namespaces.
member.remarks: This method is used to redirect base events from viewlink elements to its parents. The pre event handler can call this method to see any parents and stop firing base events. Then the event chain is redirected to the plugged designers, which in turn re-fire the base events.
member.returns: The generic parent element, if one exists, or null in case of failure.

member.summary: Fired if a find call reached the end of the document.
member.remarks: It doesn't matter whether the previous find, which causes the event to be fired, has successfully found any text. Generally, ignoring the event will wrap the find process and start at the beginning of the document again. Alternatively the Parameter stopAtEnd of second overload of the method can be used to stop. The event will always fire, even if the process stops automatically then.

member.name: E:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.UpdateUI
member.summary: Fired if the host application should update their UI (toolbars, enable/disable menu items).
member.remarks:
The event is fired on all actions that the internal processing or the user might invoke. This allows the host application to set their toolbars or menu items according to the current caret position or mouse move. See method in conjunction with EffectiveStyle is the best way to retrieve the state at the current caret or mouse pointer position.
The element delivered by the event argument () is the one the has caused the last event. If, for example, the mouse is moving over an H1 element, than this element is the one delivered by the UpdateUI event, which is fired when the mouse enters the element's borders. The reason is, that you have now the opportunity to update your UI according to the actions that might be available for this very element. The property returns the element following the insertion point (shown by the caret) and treated as the editor's current 'scope'. This is not neccesseraly the same as the one delivered by event.

member.summary: Fired if user tries to show a contextmenu with right click.
member.remarks:
Host app should provide a contextmenu shown after receiving the event (right mouse click). An alternative way is the usage of the ContextMenu as well as ContextMenuStrip property. You must assure that not both option used in the same application.
ContextMenuStrip is not available for version compiled exclusively for .NET 1.1 or prior.

member.summary: Returns the current serial number prefix the control was licensed with.
member.remarks: Note: The prefix does not contain secret information about the key or your serial number. If an user retrieves the prefix from the control he cannot activate or retrieve your license.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.Enabled
member.summary: Get or sets the control's enabled state and sets nested controls as well.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.CurrentCulture
member.summary: Sets or gets the current Culture.
member.remarks: Setting a different culture will load the language from NetRix.Localization.dll satellite DLL, which should contain the strings and images for that culture. If the culture does not exists there the default culture "en-US" will load. Once the resource is loaded, we store it in a static field to make it accessible to all classes which does not derive from HtmlEditor.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.Formatter

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.Glyphs
member.summary: Access to the glyph module.
member.remarks:
This property gives access to the advanced customizable glyph module.
Glyphs are small icons representing tags in design mode. It helps users to understand where the tags are and how they build the content. There are several glyphs available as embedded resources.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.TextSelector
member.summary: Return the currently used TextSelector.
member.remarks: The TextSelector class handles selection specifically for text, whereas HtmlSelection provides element based methods.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.WordCount
member.summary: This property returns the number of words in the document.
member.remarks: If the document is not in design mode the property will return 0. The method is time consuming. It is not recommended to call this property frequently, e.g. in mouse move or key press handlers.
The method works in design mode only.
member.example: Assuming MenuItem4 is a way the user can reach this method, the application can display the number of words using this method: Private Sub MenuItem4_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MenuItem4.Click MessageBox.Show(Me, "This document contains approximatly " + Me.HtmlEditor1.WordCount.ToString() + " Words", "Word Count", MessageBoxButtons.OK, MessageBoxIcon.Information) End Sub

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.DisableEditFocus
member.summary: Turns off the hatched border and handles around a site selectable element when the element has "edit focus" in design mode; that is, when the text or contents of the element can be edited.
member.value: True to active the property. Defaults to False.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.RespectVisibility
member.summary: When activated, the control will respect the visiblity property set to hidden and the display property set to none.
member.value: True to active the property. Defaults to False.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.BordersVisible
member.summary: Show borders around elements if they don't have own borders.
member.remarks: This makes invisible tables and blind images visible at design time. If the table designer plugin is being used it's recommended to disable this option.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.LinkedStylesheetsEnabled
member.summary: This property disables linked stylesheets temporarily in design view.
member.remarks: It does not remove the styles or link tags nor it has any effect on the final document.
member.example:
Use the following code to switch the style sheet on and off:
this.htmlEditor1.LinkedStylesheetsEnabled = e.Button.Pushed;

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.AutoUrlModeEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the automatic detection of URL and eMail addresses during text editing.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.LiveResize
member.summary: Causes the editor to update an element's appearance continuously during a resizing or moving operation, rather than updating only at the completion of the move or resize.
member.remarks: When this feature is off, an element's new position or size is indicated by a dashed rectangle until the mouse button is released.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.AtomicSelection
member.summary: Any element that has the attribute set will be selectable only as a unit.
member.remarks: In design mode, the editor's default behavior allows you to locate the insertion point in the text of any element, including elements with an ATOMICSELECTION attribute.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.MultipleSelectionEnabled
member.summary: Indicates if multiple selection is enabled in the editor.
member.remarks: Implicitly places MSHTML into multiple selection mode if set to true. This selection mode applies only if the control is in absolute positioning mode. To enter this mode just set the property AbsolutePositioningEnabled. Internally the control uses style sheets to enable HTML beeing absolute positioned. SnapEnabled AbsolutePositioningEnabled GridVisible Grid

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.AbsolutePositioningEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables absolute position for the entire editor.
member.remarks: Internally the control uses style sheets to enable HTML beeing absolute positioned. After moving positionable elements (IMG, TABLE, DIV, ...) the style "position:absolute" will be applied. If a position could be retrieved the "top" and "left" style attributes are set. Switching this property off will not remove the position information nor move the elements. After an element is first time moved with the mouse with AbsolutePositioningEnabled is off, the style "position:absolute" wil be removed. The position information will still left in the style attribute. If the property will be activated later, the style "position:absolute" is added again and the elements jump back to there previous position after the mouse touches them. SnapEnabled MultipleSelectionEnabled GridVisible Grid

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.Selection
member.summary: The current selection in the editor.
member.remarks: See for more information.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.KeepSelection
member.summary: Maintains a selection even when the control loses focus.
member.remarks: This property is useful for applications that require multiple control instances to interact with each other. One example is an e-mail application that allows users to select from a list of e-mails in one control instance and to see the actual e-mail in a second instance.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.TextFormatting

member.remarks: See for more information.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.CssTextFormatting
member.summary: The text formatting element of the editor. This class primarily supports CSS formatting.
member.remarks:
This property is new in the Netrix 2.0 Spring 2011 edition.
See for more information.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.DesignModeEnabled

member.remarks: Also places MSHTML into design mode if set to true.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.DesignModeDesired
member.summary: On creation process look for desired design state and set internally after the component was succesfully created. Called from HtmlEditor::OnCreate method.

member.name: P:GuruComponents.Netrix.HtmlEditor.Document
member.summary: Returns the document object for doing insertions.
member.remarks: If the property was called the first time and there was no document loaded the control creates a new empty document with default properties.
